H0.text: On a space station, astronauts who may spend several months orbiting Earth most likely stay while in space.

H1.text: In a space shuttle, astronauts most likely stay while spending several months in space orbiting Earth.

H2.text: On a space probe, some astronauts most likely stay while in space orbiting Earth.

H3.text: In a lunar module, astronauts most likely stay while they spend several months in space orbiting Earth.

A4.text: Crew fly expeditions of several months' duration.

A5.text: Oleg Kononenko of Roscosmos holds the record for the longest time spent in space and at the ISS, accumulating nearly 1,111 days in space over the course of five long-duration missions on the ISS (Expedition 17, 30/31, 44/45, 57/58/59 and 69/70/71).
